channel.title: Projects on Utkarsh Sinha
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Utkarsh Sinha

item.title: Project 3: Exploratory Data Analysis of IMDB dataset
item.description: The following trends were analysed in the database: Tables Overview Type of Titles in IMDB Number of titles in each genre Median Rating per genre Median Ratings over the years Number of films over the years Runtime distribution and outlier removal Runtime vs Genre Country vs Number of Movies Top 10 best and worst movies Here are some of the interesting findings: Movie ratings per genre: Apparently the worst movies are being made in the sci-fi and horror genre.

item.title: Project 2: Amazon Fine Food Reviews
item.description: Extracted amazon user data from SQL database on Kaggle using SQLite3. Ratings were integers in the range 1 to 5. All ratings below 3 were classified as negative and above 3 as positive. Reviews with rating 3 were removed. Class distribution was analysed and data was found to be imbalanced with more number of positive reviews. Duplicate review rows were deleted ( about 30% of data).

item.title: Project 1: Quora Question Pair Similarity
item.description: The data used for this project was sourced from kaggle: https://www.kaggle.com/c/quora-question-pairs Analysed the class distribution and decided on log-loss as performance metric due to imbalanced data. Extracted some basic features like number of common words and advanced features using fuzzy string matching and TFIDF Word2Vec. Visualised common words present in most duplicate and non-duplicate question pairs with word clouds.
